you
[Music]
hi and welcome you're listening to the
x22 report my name is Dave and this is
episode 1649 a and today's date is
August 27th 2018 and the top of the
episode is as the u.s. approaches a
death cross the good guys prepare the
economic transition let's get into the
economic collapse financial news now how
do you know when you're hitting at the
heart of the central bank well the
central bank of all central bank's comes
out of the darkness behind the curtain
and they come out and they say listen
everything that Trump is doing is going
to hurt the global economy and we're
already hearing from the business the
Bank of International Settlements
and you can see that they're very
nervous about what is going on here
because they realize that they're about
to be taken down and they can see what
is happening around the world and
remember they spent many many years
creating this system building it because
they thought in their minds that this
entire planet was going to be controlled
by them that we were going to have a
one-world government a one currency
system which they controlled everyone
was going to be slaves and working for
them this was the major plan and now
everything is falling apart and they're
speaking out against what is happening
and that's how you know that they know
that the clock is ticking down but what
we're seeing right now in the economy is
a complete breakdown of the entire
economic system and yes Trump needs to
keep everyone aware of how great the
economy is doing this is part of the
strategy they are using they're using
the same strategy the enemy has been
using for all these years think about it
go back in time every time the economy
went into recession what was the central
bank always telling us what was the
mainstream media always telling us
how great the economy is how fantastic
it is look at this stock market this is
exactly what Trump is doing right now
and if you look at what happened with
North Korea and many other things you
can see that he's continually using this
strategy using everything that they've
done in the past to push this new agenda
forward
so just because he's out they are saying
that the economy is doing great look at
these numbers because this is what they
always did look at our GDP numbers look
at the stock market look how great
everything is he's using this against
them and they don't know what to do at
this point because when everything
starts to fall apart he's going to say
look I made the economy great it was
better than it's ever made before it the
GDP numbers are double unemployment is
the lowest we've ever seen what has the
central bank done and this is what he's
getting prepared for not just him all
the people that are supporting everyone
that is in motion everyone that is doing
all of this they are prepared and ready
and this is not just the US it's China
it's Russia all working together and
what we're seeing right now is we're
seeing the yield curve and it's
flattening and it looks like we might
even get to an inverted yield curve and
this is why some individuals in the Fed
wanted to change the way we calculate
the yield curve now the yield curve
right now is the flattest since August
of 2007 well you know what happened in
2008 going into 2009 we were in a
recession actually we're in a recession
way before that but again they look at
the stock market and they tell you you
know later on when it were actually
started so we are now seeing a
flattening yield curve where short term
yields and long term yields move closer
together now unless the 10-year yield
gets on the rate hike bandwagon and
jumps it might soon be lower than the
two-year yield a condition called a
yield curve inversion this happens as
shorter term yields rise following the
feds
hikes but long term yields refused to
budge and then we get an inversion so
we're on an inversion watch right now
and once the spread between the two year
in the ten year move past zero that's
when we hit the inversion right now
we're at point one nine and if we go
back in time to like 2016 we were at one
point two five if we go back to 2013 we
were at two point five so here we are
already we're on inversion watch and if
this drops below zero
we're in trouble it's game over and the
yield curve flattens when the Fed
started to raise rates if we go back in
time and we look at December 14 2016 all
of a sudden we saw the US Treasury yield
curve start to flatten so we see that
it's coming
we know that the economy's in trouble
and we can see this from what is
happening with the US economic data
which is the death cross remember global
synchronous recovering well that's over
for the first time since early 2015 US
economic data is trending dramatically
more disappointing than that of Europe
in fact as the global synchronous
recovery evaporates US and European
economic data has not been so completely
decoupled and what we're seeing is the
EU macro surprise index and the US macro
surprise surprise index it looks like
we're headed towards a death course and
every time we've seen this guess what
happens we enter a recession here we are
once again headed in that way now the
Bank of International Settlements and
not just the biz but the IMF and the
rest of the central bankers they see
what is happening here and they do not
like it whatsoever the general manager
of the biz warned the greater risk is
not how many points of GDP the rising
tariffs will subtract from the US and
China but
growing danger to globalization itself
and he went on to say reversing
globalization could increase prices
raise unemployment and crimp growth
higher tariffs could actually just say
would drive up US inflation and force
the Fed to raise rates driving up the
dollar and hurting both US exports and
emerging market economies in the process
he said protectionism also threatens to
unsettle financial markets and put a
drag on firms capital spending as
investors take fright and financial
conditions tighten these real and
financial risks could amplify each other
creating a perfect storm and exacting an
even higher price basically the central
bank is out there saying listen what
Trump is doing and what the Patriots are
doing right now they are going to unwind
everything that we did and globalization
is gonna fall by the wayside and our
system the central banking system this
is remembered this is not a people
system this is their system that they
created and if you go back to 1913
that's when it all started their system
is going to fail they do not like this
this is why they're out there screaming
and yelling warning the world that it's
all going to come crashing down well
sometimes things need to come crashing
down so we can rebuild it the right way
now the good guys Trump in the Patriots
they are trying to prepare everything
for this transition and what we need to
do is we need to get out of all these
trade deals that the central bank of the
deep states set up this was for
globalization that was the only reason
they were doing this they were taking
different steps like NAFTA the next big
one was TPP which is struck down NAFTA
now was renegotiated and it's renamed
right now and you could see it's the
United States Mexico trade agreement now
Trump couldn't get rid of it all
together because I had to go through
Congress and it was going to take a very
long time and what they normally do with
these trade agreements they make it so
intertwined so you just can't come in
and say okay we don't want this anymore
but the deal was a noun
today that US and Mexico had reached a
new deal that would govern they're
totally out of whack trade relationship
and Trump came out and said you know
it's a big deal looking good with Mexico
and got rid of the name NAFTA now
remember when they created NAFTA they
told us it was going to bring jobs to
the u.s. it was going to be beneficial
for the US and the whole entire
agreement was based around wages through
the automobile manufacturers and what
they thought was going to happen was
they were going to allow Mexico and this
is what their plan was which was never
going to happen they were going to let
the population rise up to the level of
the United States and once the
population in wages rose up to the level
of the United States the automobile
workers in Mexico would be getting paid
a lot more almost equal to the United
States which will which would allow the
United States to keep all the jobs here
but what really happened well that
didn't happen at all the wages were
suppressed in Mexico think about this
for a second in Mexico they were
supposed to bring the jobs there and
somehow someway they were going to bring
the way of life of the everyday people
up to the level of the United States I
mean does that sound realistic
absolutely not
remember GM employs over 15,000
production workers in Mexico they pay
workers less than $3 per hour and
exports over 80% of the vehicles to the
US to sell here now think about what's
happening here in the United States the
UAW GM workers here in the U in the u.s.
are laid off and unemployed now if we
look at the US assembly line worker here
in the US they earn on average twenty
nine dollars and sixty sixty-two cents
per hour
and workers at component makers earn
around 20 dollars and 81 cents per our
rising wages in Mexico would squeeze
profits from those autumn will make
automobile makers and they're not going
to let that happen
so Trump really wanted to get rid of
NAFTA get rid of what was going on there
and bring the jobs back here and he
couldn't do that because it was
intertwined into Congress Congress would
have to vote on it and it wasn't as easy
as getting rid of TPP because that
wasn't really established yet and with
an executive order he was able to strike
down TPP but a key provision of the New
Deal is an increase in the mandated
locally-sourced auto content from sixty
two point five percent to seventy five
percent and that 40% to 45% of auto
contact would be made by workers earning
average base wage of $16 per hour now
according to the US trade rep the new
rules will incentivize billions annually
in additional u.s. vehicle and auto
parts production and help preserve and
reshoring distri jobs and investment the
deal also maintains duty-free access in
farm products while the countries have
also agreed to stronger rules of origin
for industrial products such as
chemicals steel intensive products class
an optical fiber the question remains
what happens now with Canada and it
looks like they're going to try to work
with Canada right now remember this deal
was only with Mexico NAFTA well that was
with Canada and Mexico and the u.s. so
Trump just made a bilateral agreement
now is this Agreement all said and done
no I think this is the beginning stages
Trump says trade deal with Mexico is
very special for manufacturers and
farmers Trump pitches us-mexico trade
deal incredible for workers Trump says
we could do a separate deal with Canada
or make them part of the deal with
Mexico Trump eventually will be able to
work out a deal with China so we can see
right now they're trying to put us in
the right position for this transition
and I think as we move forward and
everything is collapsed and
and rebuilt I think this trade agreement
is going to go through many many many
revisions and we can see already with
many other countries bilateral trade
agreements are being worked on right now
China is making a lot of bilateral trade
agreements and these bilateral trade
agreements are outside of the globalist
system yes in some cases they're still
controlled by the World Trade
Organization but we could see already
Trump already has his eye on that and
most likely going to get rid of that
because that is part of the globalist
system and remember this first stage of
we working NAFTA doesn't solve all our
problems it's impossible to solve every
single problem that these deep state
central bankers have done over the many
many years within the first two years
it's completely impossible and if he was
an unelected leader like those in the
ECB where they can push their policies
on different countries and the countries
really can't argue with them he'd be
able to take his pen write executive
orders get rid of Obamacare get rid of
NAFTA get rid of many of the laws but it
doesn't work like that way here in the
United States you still have to go
through Congress you still have to go
through other bodies of government to
get things done and we could see right
now sometimes you have to take baby
steps to get into the position that you
want and then move forward but what
we're seeing right now is this is in
preparation for this economic transition
remember we can't bring all
manufacturing back in a snap of a finger
it's going to take time it took many
many years for the central bank in the
deep state to move them offshore to
bring them all back and to build the
infrastructure to get the people trained
is something quite different and it's
going to take much longer to do that
than to move it off shore so we can see
that this is the beginning stages and
what they're doing is they're trying to
set everything up for this economic
transition because we are going to be
going through it listen everyone thanks
a lot for listening be well be safe and
especially be prepared thanks a lot
[Music]
you
